<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.02

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Changes the mass of a PhysX object. When using the alternative syntax the mass change is gradual during the given time. A time of zero means immediate change.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> When main syntax is used on [[local]] vehicle, the change is global. When alternative syntax is used with time transition on [[local]] vehicle, the gradual mass change doesn't happen on remote clients, only final mass is applied after the given time. If you need gradual change on remote clients too, [[remoteExec | remote execute]] [[setMass]] globally. </value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> myObject [[setMass]] mass

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  myObject: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value>  mass: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> myObject [[setMass]] [mass, time]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value>  myObject: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value>  mass: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value>  time: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>myObject [[setMass]] [10, 0.5];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>myObject [[setMass]] 10;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getMass]], [[setCenterOfMass]], [[getCenterOfMass]]
</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.22</value></part></template> A quick reference:
{| class="wikitable sortable"

! category
! [[setMass]]
! [[setCenterOfMass]]

|-
| unit
| The larger the mass is, the easier a unit will physically fatigued
| N/A

|-
| aircraft
| The larger the mass is, the more sensitive an aircraft will react to joystick, vice versa (Except when AFM is enabled).
| Aircraft slant due to center change accordingly, and the position of the camera view will be altered relatively at the same time. (3rd person view)

|-
| vehicle
| The larger the mass is, the slower a vehicle drives (Ships will sink), vice versa. (Land vehicle performs like a bouncing ball while ships accelerated pretty speedy.)
| Vehicle slant due to center change accordingly.

|}
